text: [Music]
the story of the G Global law school may
be worth mentioning because uh you know
um I I kind of when uh Mr naen Jindal uh
the promoter of this initiative talked
to me about this and uh I met him
sometime around the um end of 2006
when the law minister of India Mr
baradwaj introduced me to him and since
then I have talked to him about the idea
of putting in substantial uh money to
establish a global law school and a
global University on a nonprofit basis
and it took almost a year for him to you
know be convinced about it and once he
got convinced by early this year he was
ready to put in all the money and all
the resources now um we we effectively
began this project sometime in uh you
know April of this year and we are just
barely uh you know 6 months from then
and we have now um acquired over 55
acres of land uh in which the
construction of the buildings have
already begun we are in the process of
completing the construction of the
campus to almost uh you know 700,000
Square ft which will house an entire
academic block and some over 200
students housing and some uh over 45 um
uh housing for faculty all will be ready
by uh 1st of August 2009 we are working
on a FastTrack basis and the whole idea
is to be able to welcome the first batch
of our students in September 2009 and
one thing which I want to mention is
that the global uh law school agenda
commits itself to ensuring that we have
a global curriculum we have Global Cod
our es our programs are Global and our
collaborations are Global and our
interaction is also Global so at least
at five different levels we want to
promote globalization and legal
education and this uh concept of
globalization and legal education we
want to uh you know in some ways
transfer it to other schools which we
hope to establish within the university
in the years to come um Mr naen jindel
does have plans to establish Lish a
business school a school of government
on the lines of the Kennedy School of
government and a School of International
Affairs and uh uh you know over the
years we expect the OPI jundal Global
University to be a multi faulty Global
University with the Excellence in
teaching and research across many of
these schools and where students from
India and all over the world pursue
different uh undergraduate and graduate
programs we are we have begun faculty
recruitment
uh what we are going to do is that for
the first time in India we are adopting
uh what is known as the law elsat the
law school admissions Council in the US
conducts uh the test called the elsat
law school admissions test for admission
to US law schools but we have negotiated
with the law school admissions Council
in the US in fact this afternoon I have
a meeting with them to finalize the deal
basically the law school admissions
Council in the US is going to come to
India and have a law school admissions
test
uh in almost 15 centers in India uh and
this test will be announced sometime in
February and by the last week of April
which is the calendar in which India
operates we will have this uh entrance
examination and the performance of the
students in this examination will lead
to us giving them offers for admission
sometime in June and July and the
students will be coming and joining us
in the F on the 1st of September
it's a very interesting question because
in the law school context if you will um
you know law schools are in some ways
most jurisdictional places in the world
if you go to an engineering school you
will always find people from other parts
of the world because in some ways
principles of aeronautic engineering are
Universal so you will find an a student
of Aeronautical Engineering from Bolivia
to be in the US and pretty much studying
the same thing relating to Aeronautical
Engineering ing but that's not the case
as far as law school is concerned it's
one of the most jurisdictionally
oriented subjects even now so if you
look at any law school in the world even
the most globalized law schools it's
traditional graduate JD programs or law
LLB programs in many places are mostly
from people from that own jurisdiction
and the international students are more
from the in the llm program so the
master's program since the first program
we starting happens to be sort of uh
graduate program the like the JD program
we don't expect a number of
international students although we
expect students from South Asia and
Africa and Southeast Asia but I don't uh
personally expect a good number of
international students in the program
but what we do expect is two things one
is that in the years to come law will
itself become so globalized that there
will be more and more students coming
from all kinds of jurisdictions to join
any program two we have launched a
semester abroad program whereby US law
school students or any other students
can come and spend a semester at our law
school doing courses and actually
getting credits for these courses to be
taken back to their law schools now this
program we've already launched we
expecting a few law schools uh in the in
the US to take that and some send some
students uh we expecting a number of uh
at least 10 students from the us to come
and spend a semester in India uh when we
launched the postgraduate program that
is the llm program which is going to be
a global program in the sense the
interest will be uh Beyond jurisdiction
and we expect more International
students in that program
